meanings.definition: To grant or bestow (a title, degree, benefit, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The king conferred knighthood upon the brave knight.
meanings.sent2: The university conferred a prestigious award on the top student.
meanings.sent3: The magical fairy conferred the power of invisibility on the young hero.
meanings.sent4: The ancient artifact conferred immense strength to whoever possessed it.
meanings.sent5: The wise wizard conferred wisdom upon the young apprentice with a touch of his wand.

meanings.definition: To discuss or consult together; compare opinions; carry on a discussion or deliberation.
meanings.sent1: The committee conferred for hours before reaching a decision.
meanings.sent2: The team conferred about the best strategy for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent3: The animals in the forest conferred about the mysterious visitor in their midst.
meanings.sent4: The clouds and the sun conferred in the sky, deciding when to bring rain.
meanings.sent5: The students conferred with each other to solve the challenging math problem.
